Name: Assyrians
History: The Neo-Assyrian Empire, established by Adad-nirari II in the 10th century BC, was one of the greatest powers of early Antiquity. An innovator in both military tactics and governance, the Assyrians came to dominate the Middle East through the early adoption of iron weapons and maintained their power using a sophisticated network of roads and mule riders.

Technologies.Name: Mule Transports
Technologies.History: The Assyrians pioneered the use of mules in their innovative state communication system (kalliu). Mules, a hybrid of horses and donkeys, are hardier than either parent species, enabling messengers to travel reliably over long distances and rough terrain.
Technologies.Description: Merchants gain 50% higher max health and move 20% faster.

Heroes.Name: Adad-Nirari II
Heroes.History: Adad-Nirari II (ruled 912-891 B.C.). Son of Ashur-dan II. Subdued the Arameans, Hittites, and Hurrians before making massive gains in campaigns against the Babylonians. His reign saw the resurgence of both the Assyrians as a major power and of trade and prosperity in the Middle East.

Heroes.Name: Tukulti-Ninurta II
Heroes.History: Tukulti-Ninurta II (ruled 891-884 B.C.). Consolidated Assyrian rule over regions his father, Adad-Nirari II, had conquered. Subdued the Iranian peoples of the Zagros mountains. Oversaw a massive building campaign in the empire's capital cities of Ninevah and Assur.

Heroes.Name: Ashurnasirpal II
Heroes.History: Ashurnasirpal II (ruled 883â€“859 B.C.). Son of Tukulti-Ninurta II. Renowned for ruthlessly crushing revolts that occurred under his reign. Rebuilt the ruined city of Calah, making it his capital. Notable for being the first Assyrian ruler to heavily utilize cavalry and heavy siege rams in his army.

CivBonuses.Name: Population Transfer
CivBonuses.History: The Assyrians integrated conquered peoples into their empire via massive population transfers, which served to sever conquered peoples' ties to their homeland. This resulted in the rise of Aramaic as a regional lingua franca and gave the Assyrians a massive labor force with which to build their cities.
CivBonuses.Description: Assyrian settlements start with 2x normal population and have a 50% higher base growth rate.
